like there was no tomorrow.
I think she gave those judges a good sting.
And they know all about Mackenzie.
Woo-hoo!
Oh, my gosh.
Congratulations.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: It's time for Chloe to do her solo.
And this isn't going to be easy.
You know, Chloe's dancing against Maddie.
And Maddie's amazing.
And she's dancing against Justice.
And he's pretty amazing, too.
You dance for Kendall.
And you dance for Nia. And you dance for Chloe.
Because they wish they had the same chance you did.
Okay?
Okay. Okay.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: It's coming down to these two minutes on stage.
You can either do it, or you can choke.

speaker: ABBY
text: Hey, listen to me.
Maddie went out there--
nailed her number.
Brooke went out there--
nailed that number.
I need you to do it, too.
Okay.
Justice beat me last time.
And now the pressure's on that I have to beat him.
And I think "Silence" will do that.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Please welcome to the stage Chloe,
performing "Silence."

speaker: SINGER
text: âª I love only silence near âª
âª There is noise all the time âª
âª I love sunny landscapes âª
âª And I love the sky... âª

speaker: HOLLY
text: I'm very happy that Chloe won the solo.
She has worked hard.
And I think she has something to prove to Abby,
that she's a great dancer.
And she can beat Justice.
I think Chloe needs this solo, probably more than anybody else
at that studio.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Woman who will save âª

speaker: CHRISTI
text: No matter what happens with the outcome of this competition,
Chloe went out there
and she danced as well as she can.
And she didn't choke.
And she believed in herself.
So she won, no matter who gets that crown.

speaker: MAN
text: Five, six, seven, eight...

speaker: CATHY
text: I think that my bushel of Apples
think that it's fun to go up against Abby.
Do they want to see some more victories underneath their belts?
Of course.
You have to pull it together now.
Okay?
This is Nationals--
National Invitation Energy Dance.
You got to pull it together.
We don't want to go home big time losers.
Everybody got their umbrellas?

speaker: MAN
text: Let's do it. Let's go.

speaker: CATHY
text: All right. Let's go, guys.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Please welcome to the stage
Candy Apples Dance Company with "The Storm."

speaker: CATHY
text: I'm really excited about our group number.
It's creative.
And it's original.
And pieced all together, it's very well done.

speaker: SINGER
text: âª Take, take me from life âª
âª It's pouring âª
âª And there was life âª
âª And there was pain âª
âª And peer pressure once again âª
âª My heart is flooding âª
âª My soul is drowning my tears are flowing âª
âª I go out âª
âª Be my raincoat, my raincoat, my raincoat âª

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Thank you.

speaker: ABBY
text: If I was judging,
there is no way that this routine would be winning.
But I'm not a judge.
And I don't know those three people.
Let the talent speak for itself.
All right. Come on, girls.
-I need you to focus. -(tense music playing)
This is Nationals.
We came all this way and worked hard and rehearsed
in crappy little studios to get to this point.
Don't blow it right now.
Don't be the kid that ruins the entire number.
I'm confident.
The girls are confident.
But you never know.
This is a national competition.
Everybody came to win.
Let's go.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Please welcome to the stage "The Last Text."
Go, girls.
I'm a little afraid that something called
"The Last Text" may be a little too bloody and gory for a national title.

speaker: CATHY
text: Abby's girls come out.
And you know, at first, I'm thinking,
she's dragging out this crappy-looking car seat.
Did that come off of Christi's front porch?
I don't know.
But I have to tell you that her piece was just absolutely brilliant.

speaker: ABBY
text: There came that moment where it was silent.
And in a choreographer's life, or a dance teacher's life,
those moments are few and far between.
Nobody knew whether to clap, or cry, or what to do.
That was a great moment in my life.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Wow.
Okay, thank you, ladies.
Big round of applause for our t-shirt throwers.
All right, everybody.
In third place, Energy Petite Solo goes to entry number 2,
"Black Betty," Diego from Beach City Dance Center.
Our second place Energy Petite Solo goes to entry number 31,
"It's All About Me," from Beach City Dance Center.
And our first place top-scoring Energy Petite Soloist
goes to entry number 52A, "Killer Bee," Mackenzie
from the Abby Lee Dance Center.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Mackenzie is also our title winner for Miss Energy.
So we would like to crown her now.
Congratulations.
She's not Maddie.
But she's Mackenzie and she's an amazing little dancer.
I'm just very proud of her.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: We're going to move over to the Energy Teen Solo.
Our fourth place top score
goes to entry number 66, "Essence."
Our second place goes to "White, Blank Page,"
Dominique from (indistinct)
In our first place Energy Teen Solo,
Miss Energy being crowned for our 2012 National Finals
here in LA goes to Brooke Hyland,
Abby Lee Dance Center.

speaker: KELLY
text: Brooke won this national title without Abby's help.
Brooke worked her butt off in that dressing room all by herself.
She did that without her dance teacher.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Moving on to our Energy Junior Solo Division.
In fourth place is entry number 31A, Mary,
performing "Can't Touch It," from SMCB Dance Center.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: So we're down to the final three.
And the last three dancers standing are Justice, Chloe, and Maddie.
Any spot that she gets, I'm going to be proud.
She couldn't have danced better.
Third place goes to...
"Never Surrender," Justice from the Candy Apple Dance Center.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: Hallelujah.
Chloe beat Justice.
And second place Junior Solo--
which was very, very close, by a fifth of a point, goes to
"Telling Myself," Maddie Ziegler from the Abby Lee Dance Center.
Oh, my God.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: As soon as they announced Maddie as the second place winner,
everybody there knew Chloe won.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: And our first place Energy Junior Solo
for our Nationals in Beverly Hills,
also been crowned Miss Energy,
goes to Chloe from the Abby Lee Dance Center.
Congratulations.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: And we are going to crown Chloe Miss Energy today.

speaker: CHLOE
text: It feels really good to be winning Junior Miss Energy
and getting the crown and plaque and the trophy.
And this is a really good step in my dance career.
And I just hope that Maddie's happy for me, too.
Because I'm always happy for her when she wins.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Congratulations, Chloe.
So how do you feel about Little Miss Energy?
Really good.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Well, everybody did a wonderful job.
Take a bow.

speaker: ABBY
text: Chloe--
outstanding in her performance.
She was the winner.
She stood there very proud to win that crown.
And I'm thrilled.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: We're going to move over to the Energy Junior Small Group.
In third place, "The Story," Eight Count Dance Academy.

speaker: ANNOUNCER
text: Second place goes to the "Troop Beverly Hills,"
-Eight Count Dance Academy. -(cheers and applause)
And our top scoring National winner for the Energy Junior Small Group
goes to entry number 130A...
-(upbeat music playing) -(cheers and applause)
Good job, girls!
Woo-hoo!
We did it.
We came to Nationals.
We won.

speaker: GIRLS
text: Abby Lee Dance Company!

speaker: ABBY
text: The Abby Lee Dance Company remains a force
to be reckoned with.

speaker: CATHY
text: There are few dances,
in my lifetime, that I have literally walked away
and thought about days later.
And I just wanted to keep reliving Abby's "Last Text" number
because it was brilliant.

speaker: JILL
text: Kelly, what's wrong?
Nothing. I just--
it's hard to watch your kids on stage and think it's the last time
you're gonna watch them dance.
I just don't want to come back.
It has been a really hard year.
I--I'm just tired of Abby
and just the way she treats them.
Personally, I don't want to get into an argument.
But I think a lot of things are taken for granted.
And I think you don't know how lucky you have it
and how lucky your kids are.

speaker: KELLY
text: How can you really say that my kids are lucky, really?
They're here.
Every other dance studio, they're back in Pittsburgh already.
People think I'm cold.
They don't realize the hell that that woman has put me through.
Find somebody else that's gonna do what I've done for your children.
I thought Brooke was outstanding.
Yeah. But Brooke was outstanding because Brooke went over there
and practiced on her own.
Right, Kelly. She's 14 years old.
-And she should. -The entire day.
She finally wanted something.
The reason she's third, or fourth,
or sixth is because of her face.
She wised up.
She went out there and she should--
she did what she should have been doing in September.
-JILL: Congratulations! -(dramatic music playing)
Congratulations. You were beautiful.
Everybody's back in the dressing room.
The kids are celebrating.
They know they went out there and nailed it.
They felt the response of the judges and the audience.
Girls, congratulations.
Everybody that danced the solo, you were outstanding.
You beat Justice. Woo-hoo.
Brooke, you beat all those girls that were two feet taller
and their legs were up to here.
And the group number,
everybody did what they needed to do.
And everybody was an integral part of it.
And I thought it was wonderful.
We did it.
Justice...

speaker: ALL
text: Has been served.

speaker: ABBY
text: Congratulations.

speaker: JILL
text: Thank you, Abby.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: I really hope, sincerely, from the bottom of my heart,
that you put some time and space between yourself
and this situation, and you think things through.

speaker: HOLLY
text: I never really thought that the time would come that
Kelly would make a decision that she's done.
Nobody here...
wants to see any of you leave.

speaker: MELISSA
text: The team definitely won't be the same without Kelly, Paige, and Brooke.
Dysfunctional as it may be, we're definitely a family.

speaker: CHRISTI
text: This team is not a team without you guys.
It's not. You're my sister.
And you're my family.
You cannot leave me here.
You can't.
